description: "The Ann & Sandy Cross Conservation Area is a 4800 acre day use natural area located just south west of the city of Calgary in Alberta, Canada. The Cross Conservation Area is dedicated to protecting habitat and providing space for native species of wildlife; offering conservation education programs (particularly to young people) without jeopardizing wildlife and habitat; and managing human use of the Area through 'entry by appointment only.'"http://www.crossconservation.org/The Pine Creek trail is walk along a grass cover trail through rolling hills with varied terrain.Note: they do limit the number of people per day.There is a donation fee requested for parking and use of the area for the day.
directions: Highway 22X west from Calgary Just past the Calgary south on Range Rd 24 also know as 160th street.
title: Cross Conservation Area
